banjara: chittorgarh eethi, theen sau saat katmalevun leen nikalo.
notes: ee-he, eeti-from, chittorgarh eethi-from chittorgarh , theen-three, sau-hundred, saat-sixty, katmalevun-families, leen-took, nikalo-left/went

banjara: karib karib de hazaar eethi theen hazar mankya vetthe.
notes: een-to, mannkya-people, karib karib-near by/approximately,  de-two, hazaar-thousand, eethi-to, theen- hazar mankya-people, vetthe-were there.

english: An entire community searching for a new homeland.
banjara: Vu puuro samaj, navvo jaag een dhoondeen lagpade
notes: samaj-community, Vu-hat, puuro-complete, samaj-community, navvo-new. jaag een-place,  dhoondeen-searching, lagpade-started/doing.

banjara: hannu aapner baap dada vur safar chaalu vi
notes: aapner-our, eevur-of, hannu-like that, aapner-out, baap dada vur-ancestors, safar,journey, chaalu vi-started

english: By 1739, when Sant Sevalal Maharaj was born, our community faced systematic oppression.
banjara: sant Sevalal Maharaj huyo janna, satre sao thees an navv varase lugni, apner samaj katriko veela bhaavetivuthi dabge the
notes: kanna-when, aapner-our, samaj-community, sant Sevalal Maharaj-sant Sevalal Maharaj, huyo janna-when born, , satre sao thees an navv - 1739, varase lugni - by that year, apner samaj-our community, katriko-soo many, veela bhaavetivuthi-problems, dabge the-opressed

english: The caste system denied us dignity.
banjara: dusar jaatheevur kann goreevur izzat gamgi
notes: apnen-us, izzat-dignity, dusar-other, jaatheevu-cast's/clan's, kann-near, goreevur-gor's, izzat-dignity, gamgi-lost

english: We were classified as outside the social hierarchy.
banjara: apnuune kor kyar samaj eethi duur karan deete.
notes: hum-we, baar-outside, apnuune-to us, kor kyar- other than gor community, samaj-community, eethi-with, duur-far/away, karan-did, deete-saw/seen

english: Nomadic communities were labeled "Criminal Tribes" by the British.
banjara: Voor pachhe, britisheevur aathanin, goruuv shee "Criminal Tribes" kethanin naam paade
notes: panan-but, Voor pachhe-after that, britisheevur-britisher's, aathanin-came and,, goruuv shee -all Gor,Criminal-aparadhi, Tribes-aadivasi, kethanin-said so, naam paade- name was labeled.

english: Not for crimes committed, but simply for being nomadic.
banjara: keeni maar kaatecha keen koni, apan adivasi cha kethanin
notes: aapner-our, keeni-any, maar kaatecha-beating or cutting, keen-meant, koni-no, apan-we, adivasi-tribes/nomadic, cha-were, kethanin-said so
